Koreans in U.S. Meet for Aug. 15 National Festival
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Meet for Aug. 15 National Festival 
    Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- The second meeting of co-chairmen of the U.S. regional preparatory committee for the joint functions of Koreans in the north, the south and overseas to implement the June 15 joint declaration was held in Los Angeles on July 23. Discussed there was the issue of successfully ensuring the August 15 grand national festival.
 The meeting appreciated and reviewed the June 15 grand festival for national reunification held in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the historic June 15 joint declaration.    
 The participants in the meeting stressed the need to further expand and strengthen the committee and lead the Koreans in the U.S. to devote their all to implementing the joint declaration.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vietnamese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of officials in charge of foreign relations of the Vietnamese Ministry of Defence. 
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Major Gen. Pham Thanh Lan, director of the Foreign Relations Department of the Vietnamese ministry.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese 
    Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a basket of flowers by a delegation of the Shimonoseki, Japan, Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned today by Yasuharu Nakamuro, head of the delegation.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Swedish Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Swedish Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, August 4 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with Paul Beijer, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
